H0.text: North and south are the poles through which Earth's axis, an imaginary line, passes.

H1.text: West and south are the poles through which Earth's axis is an imaginary line passing.

H2.text: Southwest and south are the poles through which Earth's axis passes.

H3.text: East and North are the poles through which Earth's axis, an imaginary line, passes.

A4.text: Earthâ€™s axis points always toward the celestial poles.
